alert.note: Alert for Chuckwalla Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 29 at 5:37PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Riverside County through 645 PM PDT... At 537 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles west of Midland, or 24 miles northeast of Desert Center. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Riverside County. This includes CA Route 177 between mile markers 12 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
